newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian castor prices gain on overseas interest.
newsitem.headline: Indian castor prices gain on overseas interest.

text.p: Indian castorseed September delivery prices on Friday rose to 1,159/1,160 rupees per quintal from 1,151/1,152 rupees on the back of fresh speculative buying, dealers said.
"Increased overseas interest triggered fresh buying by bulls while rising prices prompted short-covering by bears," a dealer said.
Other dealers said fresh export inquiries for Indian castoroil by China was limited on Friday but increased interest was seen from European buyers.
"European buyers want 6,000 tonnes of Indian castoroil and this deal may be put through at 698/699 dollars per tonne," a trader said.
Groundnut oil rose by 1/2 rupees at 359/360 rupees per 10 kg amid limited arrivals due to rain in the producing centres.
Imported palm oil however moved down by 1/2 rupees at 269/270 rupees per 10 kg on arrivals of about 6,000 tonnes of imported palm oil at Bombay port.
In Rajkot spot groundnut oil slid by five rupees at 555/560 rupees per 15 kg.
